There's no shame in admitting anything, this is what you did, you can all gently come and tell us of your first experience with the command chair.

However, there is absolutely no denying it, this was it's purpose from the point it was on the drawing board. Edited May 22, 2013 by Ascensiam

Going to reflect against the assembly-csharp.dll and see if there are any API changes

*Geek Hat On*
Darn straight I did!
Honestly, the first thing I was gonna do is throw together a crudfully made wright flier that was powered with rockets, but eh. This is close enough.
How does the seat act upon landing and crashing?

Become saddened by the game not being able to load a mod part that I have on my Mun base and station.

After that, I tried launching Jeb in a seat using an SRB. Didn't work out too well, as he just sat there minding his own business:
First thing i did was change screen res, add my files, and restart the game.
I had to do it....
One of the first things I did. The first true thing I did was look at the parts and edit my flag.
I made an APC or i shall now call it AKC Armored Kerbal Carrier
do I NEED to say more?
the first thing i did was this

First thing I did was load it, check what mods aren't loading, delete them, until I get a fully running game, then test if the mods will work, then delete them if they won't, until I get a fully working game
The first thing i did was get my graphics set back to how i had them, then turn off and now i have to go to bed, having a week and 2 days left of school - not fun!
I loaded my moon rocket to check the optimisation. God, I'm boring...
Time to try out the seat and see how it is compared to the vanillia internal seat, and plant a lot of flags so the universe will know who been there hahah

Tried the new docking nodes.

And with the new editor, they now attach properly!!!
.. Yeeeeehaaaaw
Watched in horror as my flights got deleted because the parts folder changed, wept, realized I had backed it up, and now I'm putting off putting all my downloads into the proper format...

the first thing i did was this

Thrilling stuff right there. Let me know how it ends.
Spoilt between trying to find where plugin data went and launching a mission to eve that will probably end in me testing out my new retro pack to do a capsule less reentry of eve.

the official first thing i did was this

it has one of the big docking ports on the bottom

The first thing I did was read all the hilarious Knowledge Base summaries of the various planets.

Then I tried making a Mun rover, but flipped it.

Finally, I remembered that there were memory improvements in this version, so I decided to make a space station! Previously my space stations have been extraordinarily laggy, so I haven't bothered with them much until now. (It's currently a work in progress)

Now I'm working on my custom flag!

Zekes, thats an epic flag
